messages.title: Building a stronger economy and fairer society in Winchester
messages.content: Jackie Porter and the Liberal Democrats will balance the budget by 2018, cut taxes for local workers and bring back control of our borders.

messages.title: Our record of delivery
messages.content: An £800 Income Tax cut for 50,000 local workers. Halved the deficit and helped businesses create 1.9 million new jobs. Jackie has campaigned for more money to deliver fast broadband.

messages.title: Our promise of more
messages.content: Cut Income Tax by an additional £400 for low and middle income workers. Balance the budget by 2018, to bring down Britain's debt. Jackie will deliver more investment to get every home and business faster broadband.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promises to cut Income Tax by an additional £400 for low and middle income workers.
Plans to balance the budget by 2018 and bring down Britain's debt.
Aims for more investment to deliver faster broadband to every home and business, and has a record of helping businesses create new jobs.

issues.brexitEurope: bring back control of our borders.
issues.economy: balance the budget by 2018, to bring down Britain's debt.
issues.immigration: bring back control of our borders.

leaflet.personalStatement: Jackie Porter has been involved in local government for over 30 years and served as a councillor since 1991. After getting a science and engineering degree she worked in business for 9 years before retraining as a teacher.

politicalExperience.achievements: Has been involved in local government for over 30 years.

endorsements.endorsement: Jackie has an incredible local record, a passion for helping people and the real life experience an MP needs.
I'll be voting for Jackie Porter so she can deliver for Winchester and Chandler's Ford, I hope you will join me.

quotes.text: Jackie Porter will be a strong local voice, speaking up for people in Winchester, Chandler's Ford, Alresford and all our communities.

images.caption: Jackie Porter in conversation with residents.
Residents expressing support for Jackie Porter.
